voracious asked me about 2 months into development "have you considered any names aside from '100 floor medley'?"
any my response was/is
https://www.twitch.tv/ameliandyou/clip/PreciousPricklyAnteaterWOOP-HipSze2vP13OASan
I wanted the game to drop to little to no fanfare
with just my name attached to it on delfruit on day 1
and it was, until i had proof someone beat chapter 2
this was deliberately to make people think it's just some random junk game I threw together
which is also why the fangame awards trailer was so devoid of anything
the reason for this was because there's an observed effect in psychology which states that the higher your expectations are, the higher the reality has to be in order for the payout to be successful
see: https://imgur.com/a/ca88TJV
if you raise expectations and only partially meet them, the enjoyment from the player ends up being overall diminished
meanwhile, if you present yourself with a lack of expectations, and then over-fulfill on them, you create a better gameplay experience
which is why i tried to make each chapter in the game more impactful/consequential than the last
which is why I tried to make the first impressions of the game be utter indifference
oh neat. the healthbar is under the 'light' bubble
putting a shader and surface together on screen is probably not the best combo
but it works :)
i have other games that i would 100% suggest before 100fm if needle is not your thing
best fangame ever is a completely generic default tileset guy rock game nobody played that has a huge quality secret section
surface = section of the screen which you can manipulate in the same way you could manipulate images and such (panning, stretching, skewing, etc.)
shader = modifying the raw pixel displays on your monitor
u can also shoot him at the beginning, u dont need to walk to him all the time
a surface would be like putting your smartphone in front of your monitor and moving your phone to a different location while it's playing a video or something
a shader would be like changing your display settings
iirc its called objAnxiety
